1238548648956485632.text: Pleased to see @realdonaldtrump announce he will declare a national emergency. As I advocated yesterday, this is an important step in providing essential resources & flexibility to our hospital system as they prepare to battle #COVID19 on the front lines. https://t.co/0A4SsjouXy

1238257788561825792.text: Our constituents expect and deserve partisanship to be put aside in a time of crisis. All of government must work together to help lead our country through this outbreak. We will get through this. How quickly and how successfully is up to us to decide.

1238257712468762629.text: Congressionally, steps need to be taken to provide economic assistance to those who are most vulnerable, increase our nation’s healthcare capacity including instituting a full government approach to solve the testing backlog, and provide stability to the financial markets.

1238257643522789377.text: It is clear from my conversations with healthcare providers as well as @OHdeptofhealth officials that the President must immediately declare a national emergency. This would free up important resources & provide flexibility to providers.

1238257443001565185.text: #COVID19 is developing fast in the US, & as we saw with Italy, when dramatic steps are not taken early, more lives are put at risk. We must act quickly & decisively to prevent a full-blown health crisis that could endanger more people & lead to a financial recession.

1238257368141574146.text: A few hours ago, I released a statement outlining what I believe is the best path forward on #COVID19. Our goal is straightforward. We need to protect the vulnerable while making sure that this economic panic does not lead to a financial crisis. More here: https://t.co/0A4SsjouXy

1095380496631189506.text: As a new father, it is hard to imagine a world in which the killing of a newborn child is acceptable, let alone legal in our country. The Born Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act should not be a partisan bill. It is common sense.

1092852107739316230.text: We need to ensure we are doing our jobs, and that means putting an end to government shutdowns or, at the very least, ensuring lawmakers are not paid in the event of one. It is time to make Washington work for the people again.

1092851959101620224.text: For me, this is simple: our government has a responsibility to the men and women of this country to come together and solve our big challenges. I have been working in a bipartisan manner here in Congress to do just that.

1081324803435491328.text: I’m proud to have voted on legislation today to help update Congress with new technology, streamlined administrative processes and improved staff recruitment to help our workplace reflect the diverse makeup of our country at large. #116thCongress

1081324717255151617.text: I came to Congress on a promise to make our government work for the people again, and a big part of that is bringing this governing body into the 21st Century. On my second day in Congress, it’s already clear that the modernization of Congress is long overdue.

1081247124786958337.text: I look forward to supporting those efforts.

1081247124262662144.text: The bill we voted on yesterday was neither a compromise nor a realistic solution to funding our government. Leadership from both parties need to come together and work in a meaningful bipartisan manner to fund the government and put our country back on track.

1081246968863703045.text: We have a responsibility to the men and women of this country to come together in a bipartisan manner to solve our big challenges. That starts with funding the government in a way that responsibly secures our border.

1080944442922713091.text: Proud to represent Ohio's 16th Congressional District in Congress. Follow me here for updates on my official work. https://t.co/cbMS6Z9Nr2
